The Digital Heart Lab (DHlab) in the Department of Biomedical Engineering,
National University of Singapore (NUS) has multiple openings for PhD students,
Postdoc, research assistants, and visitors. Our lab is committed to
interdisciplinary research at the intersection of AI, cardiac modeling, and
medical image analysis.

About Us

DHlab is affiliated in the NUS, which is an internationally renowned research
university, ranked 8th in the QS World University Rankings 2025. We aim to
develop advanced AI models for creating cardiac digital twins, i.e.,
personalized virtual heart models. We will employ the dataset (imaging, ECG,
electronic medical records, etc) collected from patients, to accurately
modelling the anatomy and simulate the function of patients' diseased hearts.
These models, coupled with machine learning techniques, contribute to the
identification of crucial mechanistic relationships and features that offer
insights into the trajectory of a patient's heart condition. The research will
delve into the intersection of AI and cardiac sciences, exploring novel
approaches to revolutionize our understanding of the human heart. With the
potential to impact medical treatments and technology advancements, it promises
an exciting and important avenue for personalized medicine. We will collaborate
with a multi-disciplinary team, including academics/ experts from NUS,
University of Oxford, University of Southampton, Imperial College London, Fudan
University, etc.

Research Areas

 * Medical Image Analysis
   
   * Aim: create 3D(+t) anatomical model from medical imaging.
   * Tech: image segmentation, motion extraction, mesh reconstruction, etc.

 * Electrophysiological Modelling
   
   * Aim: simulate and inverse infer the electrical activity in the heart.
   * Tech: mathematics modelling, signal processing, inverse inference, etc.

 * Machine Learning
   
   * Aim: establish AI models to advance cardiac modelling and simulation.
   * Tech: multi-modal AI, neural surrogate model, physics-informed model, etc.

 * Cardiac Digital Twin Application
   
   * Aim: employ the cardiac digital twins to assiss the personalized diagnosis
     and treatment of atrial fibrillation (AF), myocardial infarction (MI),
     ventricle tachycardia (VT), etc.
   * Tech: clinical evaluation, system development, interactive system, etc

PhD Opening Details

 * Requirement
   
   * Being self-motivated and enthusiastic about AI for healthcare.
   * Have a good first degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, data
     science, applied statistics/ mathematics, or any-related field.
   * Strong problem-solving abilities and learning capability, such as top xx%,
     ranking xx out of xx, in your previous studies.
   * Proficiency in programming (Python, C++, etc) and in English reading &
     writing (requirements made by NUS: TOEFL/ IELTS/ GRE)
   * First-authored relative publication in top-tier journals and conferences
     are preferred.

 * Funding
   
   * Full PhD scholarships are available in the DHlab.
   * For excellent students, we will also recommend you to apply for other
     fundings, such as:
     * AISG PhD Fellowship
     * President's Graduate Fellowship
   * Furthermore, you can see fundings from others, such as:
     * A*STAR Singapore International Graduate Award (SINGA)
     * CSC Scholarship (only for visiting students from China)

 * How To Apply
   
   * Please send your CV, 1 page research statement, undergraduate transcripts
     (in English), and any other supporting materials, to lilei.sky@outlook.com.
     Email subject can be "PhD Application - Your University - Your Name".
   * ðŸŒŸ Please fill out this brief DHlab Application Form, so I will not miss
     your application.
   * If your application materials are a good fit, I will reach out to you and
     encourage you to apply online in the NUS application system. Here are a few
     tips:
     * Apply for a PhD program rather than EngD.
     * For the source of finance, choose the NUS Research Scholarship or
       indicate any other funding you may have.
     * Be sure to select me as your proposed supervisor.
   * If you are a Singaporean/ PR, or you are willing to undertake a 3-year
     service obligation, i.e. work in Singapore after graduation, the admission
     bar may be slightly lower.

Postdoc Opening Details

 * Requirement
   
   * Hold a PhD degree in biomedical engineering, computer science, data
     science, applied statistics/ mathematics, or any-related field.
   * Strong publication record and related research experience.
   * Candidates with successful proposal writing experience are preferred.

 * Salary
   
   * The competitive salary (~5500 SGD per month) is provided with NUS benefits,
     which can be discussed if you are exceptionally excellent.

 * How To Apply
   
   * Please send your CV, 1-2 page research statement, papers, and any other
     supporting materials, to lilei.sky@outlook.com. Email subject can be
     "Postdoc Application - Your University - Your Name".
   * ðŸŒŸ Please fill out this brief DHlab Postdoc Application Form, so I will not
     miss your application.
   * If your application materials are a good fit, I will reach out to you for a
     formal interview.

Other Research Positions Available

In addition to PhD positions, opportunities are available for research assistant
(RA) and visiting roles.

 * Application Process: Please refer to the instructions in the PhD section
   above for guidance on how to apply.

 * Internship Information:
   
   * NUS BS/MS/FYP Students: You are encouraged to register for research courses
     to demonstrate your commitment. Please note that typically, no funding is
     provided for these positions.
   * External BS/MS Students: Internship opportunities may be available for
     exceptionally outstanding candidates who express a strong interest in
     pursuing a PhD with us in the future.

Given the high volume of emails I receive, I may not be able to respond to all
applicants. Please understand that this does not reflect on your qualifications
or potential. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Biography#

Dr. Lei Li is an Assistant Professor of National University of Singapore (NUS).
Previously, she was a Lecturer at the School of Electronics & Computer Science,
University of Southampton and a Postdoc at the Institute of Biomedical
Engineering, University of Oxford. She received her Ph.D. degree in the School
of Biomedical Engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University (SJTU) in 2021 and
obtained the SJTU 2021 Outstanding Doctoral Graduate Development Scholarship.
She has been selected as the Rising Star of Women in Engineering by Asian Deans'
Forum 2023 and Featured Women in Science by RSIP Vision. She serves as Board
Member of SIG-Cardiac and Women in MICCAI (WiM) and Area Chair of MICCAI 2024.
Her research interest is AI for healthcare, specifically focusing on cardiac
digital twins, medical imaging, and multi-modal AI.

Miss Xicheng Sheng is currently a master student at the School of Data Science,
Fudan University (Shanghai, China), co-supervised by Prof. Xiahai Zhuang and Dr.
Lei Li. She obtained her B.S. degree in statistics from the School of
Management, Fudan University in 2022. She is passionate about exploring the
intersection of medical data analysis and healthcare innovation.

Mr Xingtao Lin currently is a PhD student in Fuzhou University (Fuzhou, China),
co-supervised by Prof. Xiahai Zhuang, Prof. Liqin Huang, Dr. Lei Li. He obtained
his master and bachelor degree in Fuzhou University (Fuzhou, China) in 2023 and
2019, seperately. His research interest is atrial fibrillation, with a primary
focus on improving the efficiency of diagnosis and treatment for this condition.
He is also concerned with how factors such as healthy eating, regular exercise,
and effective stress management impact heart health.

Fudan University in 2023. His research interests focus on computer vision,
particularly in the medical image computing. He is also passionate about
programming and has a strong enthusiasm for the open-source community.

Mr Yilin Lyu will join in us as a PhD student in DHlab of NUS, supervised by Dr.
